intro: Oxyspora balansae var. setosa, commonly known as the hairy oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide structural support and aid in water retention. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
